title: Man is crushed to death by a bulldozer after it rolled on top of him in a horrific farming accident
text:
An elderly man has been crushed to death by a bulldozer in a horrific farming accident.

The 70-year-old, from Emu Vale, west of the Gold Coast, was using the machine to prepare his land against bushfires on Sunday afternoon when it rolled.

He was last seen using the equipment about 1.15pm on a private property on Upper Emu Creek Rd, The Courier Mail reported.

The 70-year-old, from Emu Vale, 200km west of the Gold Coast, was using the machine to prepare his land against bushfires on Sunday afternoon when it rolled (stock image)

He was later found around 4.15pm and died at the scene.

Inspector Paul James said initial investigations revealed the man had been clearing firebreaks on his land when the accident occurred.

Forensic Crash Unit investigators were called to the property.

The incident has since been referred to Workplace Health and Safety Queensland after they were notified by police.
